00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  * @brief   Cost matrix functions for the symmetric BTSP.
00003  *
00004  * Cost matrix transformation functions for the symmetric bottleneck traveling
00005  * salesman problem (SBTSP).
00006  *
00007  * @author  John LaRusic
00008  * @ingroup lib
00009  ****************************************************************************/
00010 #include "common.h"
00011 #include "btsp.h"

00013 /****************************************************************************
00014  * Private structures
00015  ****************************************************************************/

00018 /****************************************************************************
00019  * Private function prototypes
00020  ****************************************************************************/
00021 /**
00022  *  @brief  Retrieves cost between nodes i and j from the function.
00023  *  @param  fun [in] function structure
00024  *  @param  base_problem [in] problem structure
00025  *  @param  delta [in] delta parameter
00026  *  @param  i [in] id of start node
00027  *  @param  j [in] id of end node
00028  *  @return cost between node i and node j
00029  */
00030 int
00031 basic_get_cost(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *base_problem,
00032                int delta, int i, int j);
00033                
00034 /**
00035  *  @brief  Initializes the function data.
00036  *  @param  fun [out] the function structure to initialize
00037  */
00038 int
00039 basic_initialize(arrow_btsp_fun *fun);
00040               
00041 /**
00042  *  @brief  Destructs the function data.
00043  *  @param  fun [out] the function structure to destruct
00044  */
00045 void
00046 basic_destruct(arrow_btsp_fun *fun);
00047 
00048 /**
00049  *  @brief  Determines if the given tour is feasible or not.
00050  *  @param  fun [in] function structure
00051  *  @param  problem [in] the problem to check against
00052  *  @param  delta [in] delta parameter
00053  *  @param  tour_length [in] the length of the given tour
00054  *  @param  tour [in] the tour in node-node format
00055  *  @return ARROW_TRUE if the tour is feasible, ARROW_FALSE if not
00056  */
00057 int
00058 basic_feasible(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *problem,
00059                int delta, double tour_length, int *tour);
00060 
00061 
00062 /****************************************************************************
00063  * Public function implementations
00064  ****************************************************************************/
00065 int
00066 arrow_btsp_fun_basic(int shallow, arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00067 {    
00068     fun->data = NULL;
00069     fun->shallow = shallow;
00070     fun->get_cost = basic_get_cost;
00071     fun->initialize = basic_initialize;
00072     fun->destruct = basic_destruct;
00073     fun->feasible = basic_feasible;
00074     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00075 }
00076 
00077 
00078 /****************************************************************************
00079  * Private function implementations
00080  ****************************************************************************/
00081 int
00082 basic_get_cost(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *base_problem,
00083                int delta, int i, int j)
00084 {
00085     int cost = base_problem->get_cost(base_problem, i, j);
00086     return (cost <= delta ? 0 : cost);
00087 }
00088 
00089 int
00090 basic_initialize(arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00091 { 
00092     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00093 }
00094 
00095 void
00096 basic_destruct(arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00097 { }
00098 
00099 int
00100 basic_feasible(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *problem, 
00101                int delta, double tour_length, int *tour)
00102 {
00103     return (tour_length <= 0 ? ARROW_TRUE : ARROW_FALSE);
00104 }
